avalancheActivity.comment:
A lot of new snow above approximately 2200 m. This applies in particular towards the evening.
Avalanches can be released very easily and reach dangerously large size. Exposed buildings and exposed parts of transportation routes are endangered in isolated cases in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
Below approximately 2200 m moist and wet avalanches are possible. In particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers.
The conditions are very dangerous for ski touring, freeriding and snowshoe hiking.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The large quantity of fresh snow as well as the often large wind slabs will become increasingly prone to triggering. Numerous dry and wet avalanches are to be expected at any time, but they can be dangerously large.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The sleet will give rise to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, large wind slabs formed in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
These spring-like weather conditions will give rise to unfavourable bonding of the snowpack over a wide area in all altitude zones.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Intensive precipitation: This applies especially in the evening.
Large quantities of fresh snow and the wind-drifted snow can be released naturally in all aspects. Many large and, in isolated cases, very large avalanches are possible.
Avalanches can reach valley bottoms and in some places endanger exposed transportation routes.
Below approximately 2200 m medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large moist and wet avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wet snow require caution. Especially in the regions exposed to precipitation large natural avalanches, capable of reaching a long way, must be expected.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The sleet will give rise to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, large wind slabs formed in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
These spring-like weather conditions will give rise to unfavourable bonding of the snowpack over a wide area in particular in all altitude zones.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Over a wide area heavy precipitation. The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses.
From high-altitude starting zones in particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation the avalanches can reach large size and in some places endanger transportation routes, including those situated at relatively low altitudes. This applies especially in the regions with a lot of snow.
Increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches until the temperature drops.
The conditions are critical for ski touring, freeriding and snowshoe hiking.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Gradual increase in danger of dry and wet avalanches as a consequence of the precipitation. Avalanches can reach valley bottoms and endanger exposed transportation routes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Up to intermediate altitudes rain will fall over a wide area. A lot of new snow in the high Alpine regions. As a consequence of new snow and wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed in the last few days.
The sleet will give rise to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
These spring-like weather conditions will give rise to unfavourable bonding of the snowpack over a wide area in particular in all altitude zones.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the precipitation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent in the afternoon.
As the penetration by moisture increases more frequent wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses below approximately 2200 m.
The more recent wind slabs will be covered with new snow and therefore difficult to recognise. New snow and wind slabs can in some places be released easily and reach large size in isolated cases.
The current avalanche situation calls for great caution and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Gradual increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of the precipitation.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Up to intermediate altitudes rain will fall over a wide area. The sleet will give rise to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
As a consequence of new snow and wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed in the last few days in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
These spring-like weather conditions will give rise to unfavourable bonding of the snowpack over a wide area in particular in all altitude zones.
